name: The Image Centre's Winter Exhibitions
description:
Enjoy four incredible exhibitions on view. 

"Magnum's First", revisits Magnum Photos' 1955 debut exhibition, "Face of Time", rediscovered in 2006 after decades unseen.

Chim's Children of Europe by David "Chim" Seymour documents the lives of children across post-war Europe.

Mark Igloliorte: Tuvak Akkusinialuk Siaggijâk (Ice-Road Skating), follows four Indigenous skateboarders traveling the frozen Dettah Ice Road in the Northwest Territories.

Staging Celia Franca explores the off-stage wardrobe of Celia Franca, Founder and Artistic Director of the National Ballet of Canada.

name: Shutter Space
description:
Viewers are invited into a visual journey where the stillness of nature and the pulse of the urban world converge. 

This exhibit brings together a curated selection of landscape and cityscape photography, each frame capturing a distinct encounter between place, light, and perspective.

 From sweeping natural vistas to the intricate geometry of metropolitan life, the works in Shutter Space explore how environments shape us and how we, in return, shape them.

name: Make Banana Cry
description:
"Banana" isn't just slang, it's a symbol of the performance, erasure, and reclamation of self.

Choreographers Andrew Tay and Stephen Thompson are the co-creators of this genre-defying work merging runway aesthetics with contemporary performance and dance. 

In an attempt to shake off the weight of representation and fetishization, an international cast of six East Asian artists critique, parody, and protest stereotypes of "Asian-ness." Slipping between the codes of couture and contemporary art, straddling spectacles of consumption and entertainment, this performance is an impressive demonstration of physicality, an unrelenting examination of Western xenophobia, and an ingenious show of humour and wit.  

Presented for the first time in Toronto after critically acclaimed performances at Impulstanz (Vienna), Portland Institute of Contemporary Art and Festival TransAmériques (Montreal).

name: Toronto Career Fair and Training Expo
description:
Attention opporutnity seekers! 

We're back and better than ever, helping you advance your career in the right direction! Get in front of hiring managers, and network and apply to our recruiting exhibitors.

Learn about exciting new career options and obtain valuable information about how to earn the credentials and diplomas you need to get the job you want with our training and career college exhibitors.

name: "the road less travelled" by Simeon Posen
description:
Sim Posen is a landscape and architectural photographer with works spanning over four decades. His studies in architecture and stage design contribute to the unique perspective evident in his black and white photographs, illuminating the intricacies of the parts to express the structure of the whole, whether created by nature or by man.

Posen's technique, style and composition are also influenced by such photographers as Marie Cosindas, Wynn Bullock and Brett Weston and Ansel Adams with whom he studied in California.

organizer.name: Foundation for the Study of Objective Art
